t: Jeremiah 50
A Message About Babylon
This*p is the word the Lord*s spoke through Jeremiah the prophet concerning Babylon and the land of the Babylonians:

“Announce*pn and proclaim among the nations, lift*ld up a banner and proclaim it; keep*ld nothing back, but say, ‘Babylon*ln will be captured; Bel*ld will be put to shame, Marduk*ld filled with terror. Her*ln images will be put to shame and*ld her idols filled with terror.’
A*ln nation from the north will attack her and*ld lay waste her land. No*ln one will live in it; both*ld people and animals will flee away.
“In*pn those days, at that time,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “the*ln people of Israel and the people of Judah together will*ld go in tears to seek the Lord*s their God.
They*ln will ask the way to Zion and*ld turn their faces toward it. They*ln will come and bind themselves to the Lord*s in*ld an everlasting covenant that*ld will not be forgotten.
“My*pn people have been lost sheep; their*ld shepherds have led them astray and*ld caused them to roam on the mountains. They*ln wandered over mountain and hill and*ld forgot their own resting place.
Whoever*ln found them devoured them; their*ld enemies said, ‘We are not guilty, for*ln they sinned against the Lord,*s their verdant pasture, the*ld Lord,*s the hope of their ancestors.’
“Flee*pn out of Babylon; leave*ld the land of the Babylonians, and*ld be like the goats that lead the flock.

For*ln I will stir up and bring against Babylon an*ld alliance of great nations from the land of the north. They*ln will take up their positions against her, and*ld from the north she will be captured. Their*ln arrows will be like skilled warriors who*ld do not return empty-handed.
So*ln Babylonia will be plundered; all*ld who plunder her will have their fill,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Because*pn you rejoice and are glad, you*ld who pillage my inheritance, because*ln you frolic like a heifer threshing grain and*ld neigh like stallions,
your*ln mother will be greatly ashamed; she*ld who gave you birth will be disgraced. She*ln will be the least of the nations— a*ld wilderness, a dry land, a desert.
Because*ln of the Lord’s*s anger she will not be inhabited but*ld will be completely desolate. All*ln who pass Babylon will be appalled; they*ld will scoff because of all her wounds.
“Take*pn up your positions around Babylon, all*ld you who draw the bow. Shoot*ln at her! Spare no arrows, for*ld she has sinned against the Lord.*s

Shout*ln against her on every side! She*ld surrenders, her towers fall, her*ld walls are torn down. Since*ln this is the vengeance of the Lord,*s take*ld vengeance on her; do*ld to her as she has done to others.

Cut*ln off from Babylon the sower, and*ld the reaper with his sickle at harvest. Because*ln of the sword of the oppressor let*ld everyone return to their own people, let*ld everyone flee to their own land.
“Israel*pn is a scattered flock that*ld lions have chased away. The*ln first to devour them was*ld the king of Assyria; the*ln last to crush their bones was*ld Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.”
Therefore*p this is what the Lord*s Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “I*pn will punish the king of Babylon and his land as*ld I punished the king of Assyria.
But*ln I will bring Israel back to their own pasture, and*ld they will graze on Carmel and Bashan; their*ln appetite will be satisfied on*ld the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.

In*ln those days, at that time,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “search*ln will be made for Israel’s guilt, but*ld there will be none, and*ln for the sins of Judah, but*ld none will be found, for*ld I will forgive the remnant I spare.
“Attack*pn the land of Merathaim and*ld those who live in Pekod. Pursue,*ln kill and completely destroy them,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “Do*ld everything I have commanded you.
The*ln noise of battle is in the land, the*ld noise of great destruction!
How*ln broken and shattered is*ld the hammer of the whole earth! How*ln desolate is Babylon among*ld the nations!
I*ln set a trap for you, Babylon, and*ld you were caught before you knew it; you*ln were found and captured because*ld you opposed the Lord.*s
The*ln Lord*s has opened his arsenal and*ld brought out the weapons of his wrath, for*ln the Sovereign Lord*s Almighty has work to do in*ld the land of the Babylonians.
Come*ln against her from afar. Break*ld open her granaries; pile*ld her up like heaps of grain. Completely*ln destroy her and*ld leave her no remnant.
Kill*ln all her young bulls; let*ld them go down to the slaughter! Woe*ln to them! For their day has come, the*ld time for them to be punished.
Listen*ln to the fugitives and refugees from Babylon declaring*ld in Zion how*ln the Lord*s our God has taken vengeance, vengeance*ld for his temple.

“Summon*pn archers against Babylon, all*ld those who draw the bow. Encamp*ln all around her; let*ld no one escape. Repay*ln her for her deeds; do*ld to her as she has done. For*ln she has defied the Lord,*s the*ld Holy One of Israel.
Therefore,*ln her young men will fall in the streets; all*ld her soldiers will be silenced in that day,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“See,*pn I am against you, you arrogant one,” declares*ld the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, “for*ln your day has come, the*ld time for you to be punished.
The*ln arrogant one will stumble and fall and*ld no one will help her up; I*ln will kindle a fire in her towns that*ld will consume all who are around her.”
This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “The*pn people of Israel are oppressed, and*ld the people of Judah as well. All*ln their captors hold them fast, refusing*ld to let them go.
Yet*ln their Redeemer is strong; the*ld Lord*s Almighty is his name. He*ln will vigorously defend their cause so*ld that he may bring rest to their land, but*ld unrest to those who live in Babylon.
“A*pn sword against the Babylonians!” declares*ld the Lord—*s “against*ln those who live in Babylon and*ld against her officials and wise men!
A*ln sword against her false prophets! They*ld will become fools. A*ln sword against her warriors! They*ld will be filled with terror.
A*ln sword against her horses and chariots and*ld all the foreigners in her ranks! They*ld will become weaklings. A*ln sword against her treasures! They*ld will be plundered.
A*ln drought on her waters! They*ld will dry up. For*ln it is a land of idols, idols*ld that will go mad with terror.
“So*pn desert creatures and hyenas will live there, and*ld there the owl will dwell. It*ln will never again be inhabited or*ld lived in from generation to generation.
As*ln I overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah along*ld with their neighboring towns,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “so*pn no one will live there; no*ld people will dwell in it.
“Look!*pn An army is coming from the north; a*ld great nation and many kings are*ld being stirred up from the ends of the earth.

They*ln are armed with bows and spears; they*ld are cruel and without mercy. They*ln sound like the roaring sea as*ld they ride on their horses; they*ln come like men in battle formation to*ld attack you, Daughter Babylon.
The*ln king of Babylon has heard reports about them, and*ld his hands hang limp. Anguish*ln has gripped him, pain*ld like that of a woman in labor.

Like*ln a lion coming up from Jordan’s thickets to*ld a rich pastureland, I*ln will chase Babylon from its land in an instant. Who*ld is the chosen one I will appoint for this? Who*ln is like me and who can challenge me? And*ld what shepherd can stand against me?”

Therefore,*pn hear what the Lord*s has planned against Babylon, what*ld he has purposed against the land of the Babylonians: The*ln young of the flock will be dragged away; their*ld pasture will be appalled at their fate.
At*ln the sound of Babylon’s capture the earth will tremble; its*ld cry will resound among the nations.
